Condition.Description: Operating system is Windows NT4 and service pack 'n'
Operating system is Windows 2000 and service pack 'n'
Operating system is Windows XP and service pack 'n'
Operating system is Windows XP Home and service pack 'n'
Condition.Condition: VersionNT = 501 AND MsiNTSuitePersonal AND ServicePackLevel = n

Condition.Description: Operating system is Windows Vista SP1
Physical memory greater than or equal to 1GB

WindowsProperty.Name: OriginalDatabase
WindowsProperty.Description: The installer sets this property to the launched-from database, the database on the source, or the cached database.

WindowsProperty.Name: ParentOriginalDatabase
WindowsProperty.Description: The installer sets this property for installations run by a Concurrent Installation action.

WindowsProperty.Name: SourceDir
WindowsProperty.Description: Root directory that contains the source files.

WindowsProperty.Name: TARGETDIR
WindowsProperty.Description: Specifies the root destination directory for the installation. During an administrative installation this property is the location to copy the installation package.

WindowsProperty.Name: ACTION
WindowsProperty.Description: Initial action called after the installer is initialized.

WindowsProperty.Name: ALLUSERS
WindowsProperty.Description: Determines where configuration information is stored.

WindowsProperty.Name: ARPAUTHORIZEDCDFPREFIX
WindowsProperty.Description: URL of the update channel for an application.

WindowsProperty.Name: ARPCOMMENTS
WindowsProperty.Description: Provides Comments for the Add or Remove Programs in Control Panel.

WindowsProperty.Name: ARPCONTACT
WindowsProperty.Description: Provides Contact for the Add or Remove Programs in Control Panel.

WindowsProperty.Name: ARPINSTALLLOCATION
WindowsProperty.Description: Fully qualified path to the primary folder of an application.

WindowsProperty.Name: ARPNOMODIFY
WindowsProperty.Description: Disables functionality that modifies a product.

WindowsProperty.Name: ARPNOREMOVE
WindowsProperty.Description: Disables functionality that removes a product.

WindowsProperty.Name: ARPNOREPAIR
WindowsProperty.Description: Disables the Repair button in the Programs wizard.

WindowsProperty.Name: ARPPRODUCTICON
WindowsProperty.Description: Specifies the primary icon for the installation package.

WindowsProperty.Name: ARPREADME
WindowsProperty.Description: Provides a ReadMe for the Add or Remove Programs in Control Panel.

WindowsProperty.Name: ARPSIZE
WindowsProperty.Description: Estimated size of an application in kilobytes.

WindowsProperty.Name: ARPSYSTEMCOMPONENT
WindowsProperty.Description: Prevents display of an application in the Add or Remove Programs list.

WindowsProperty.Name: ARPURLINFOABOUT URL
WindowsProperty.Description: for the home page of an application.

WindowsProperty.Name: ARPURLUPDATEINFO
WindowsProperty.Description: URL for application update information.

WindowsProperty.Name: AVAILABLEFREEREG
WindowsProperty.Description: Registry space (in kilobytes) that an application requires. Used by AllocateRegistrySpace action.

WindowsProperty.Name: CCP_DRIVE
WindowsProperty.Description: The root path for qualifying products for CCP.

WindowsProperty.Name: DefaultUIFont
WindowsProperty.Description: Default font style used for controls.

WindowsProperty.Name: DISABLEADVTSHORTCUTS
WindowsProperty.Description: Set to disable the generation the specific shortcuts that support installation-on-demand.

WindowsProperty.Name: DISABLEMEDIA
WindowsProperty.Description: Prevents the installer from registering media sources, such as a CD-ROMs, as valid sources for the product.

WindowsProperty.Name: DISABLEROLLBACK
WindowsProperty.Description: Disables rollback for the current configuration.

WindowsProperty.Name: EXECUTEACTION
WindowsProperty.Description: Top-level action that ExecuteAction initiates.

WindowsProperty.Name: EXECUTEMODE
WindowsProperty.Description: Mode of execution that the installer performs.

WindowsProperty.Name: FASTOEM
WindowsProperty.Description: Improves installation performance under specific OEM scenarios.

WindowsProperty.Name: INSTALLLEVEL
WindowsProperty.Description: Initial level where features are installed.

WindowsProperty.Name: LIMITUI
WindowsProperty.Description: UIlevel capped as Basic.

WindowsProperty.Name: LOGACTION
WindowsProperty.Description: List of action names to be logged.

WindowsProperty.Name: MEDIAPACKAGEPATH
WindowsProperty.Description: This property must be set to the relative path if the installation package is not located at the root of the CD-ROM.

WindowsProperty.Name: MSIARPSETTINGSIDENTIFIER
WindowsProperty.Description: This optional property contains a semi-colon delimited list of the registry locations where the application stores a user's settings and preferences. Available with Windows Installer 4.0.

WindowsProperty.Name: MSIDISABLEEEUI
WindowsProperty.Description: Disable the embedded user interface for the installation. Windows Installer 4.0 and earlier: Not supported.

WindowsProperty.Name: MSIFASTINSTALL
WindowsProperty.Description: Reduce the time required to install a large Windows Installer package. Windows Installer 4.5 and earlier: Not supported.

WindowsProperty.Name: MSIINSTALLPERUSER
WindowsProperty.Description: Requests that the Windows Installer install the package only for the current user. Windows Installer 4.5 and earlier: Not supported.

WindowsProperty.Name: MSINODISABLEMEDIA
WindowsProperty.Description: Set this property to prevent the installer from setting the DISABLEMEDIA property.

WindowsProperty.Name: MSIENFORCEUPGRADECOMPONENTRULES
WindowsProperty.Description: Set this property to 1 (one) on the command line or in the Property Table to apply the upgrade component rules during small updates and minor upgrades of a specific product. Available beginning with Windows Installer 3.0.

WindowsProperty.Name: MSIUNINSTALLSUPERSEDEDCOMPONENTS
WindowsProperty.Description: When this property has been set to 1, the installer can unregister and uninstall redundant components to prevent leaving behind orphan components on the computer. Windows Installer 4.0 and earlier: Not supported.

WindowsProperty.Name: PRIMARYFOLDER
WindowsProperty.Description: Allows the author to designate a primary folder for an installation. Used to determine the values for the PrimaryVolumePath, PrimaryVolumeSpaceAvailable, PrimaryVolumeSpaceRequired, and PrimaryVolumeSpaceRemaining properties.

WindowsProperty.Name: Privileged
WindowsProperty.Description: Runs an installation with elevated privileges.

WindowsProperty.Name: PROMPTROLLBACKCOST
WindowsProperty.Description: Action if there is insufficient disk space for the installation.

WindowsProperty.Name: REBOOT
WindowsProperty.Description: Forces or suppresses a restart.

WindowsProperty.Name: REBOOTPROMPT
WindowsProperty.Description: Suppresses the display of prompts for restarts to the user. Any restarts that are needed happen automatically.

WindowsProperty.Name: ROOTDRIVE
WindowsProperty.Description: Default drive for an installation.

WindowsProperty.Name: SEQUENCE
WindowsProperty.Description: A table that has the sequence table schema.

WindowsProperty.Name: SHORTFILENAMES
WindowsProperty.Description: Causes short file names to be used.

WindowsProperty.Name: TRANSFORMS
WindowsProperty.Description: List of transforms to be applied to a database.

WindowsProperty.Name: TRANSFORMSATSOURCE
WindowsProperty.Description: Informs the installer that the transforms for a product reside at the source.

WindowsProperty.Name: TRANSFORMSSECURE
WindowsProperty.Description: Setting the TRANSFORMSECURE property to 1 (one) informs the installer that transforms are to be cached locally on the user computer in a location where the user does not have write access.

WindowsProperty.Name: MsiLogFileLocation
WindowsProperty.Description: The installer sets the value of this property to the full path of the log file, when logging has been enabled. This property is available starting with Windows Installer 4.0.

WindowsProperty.Name: MsiLogging
WindowsProperty.Description: Sets the default logging mode for the Windows Installer package. This property is available starting with Windows Installer 4.0.

WindowsProperty.Name: MSIUSEREALADMINDETECTION
WindowsProperty.Description: Set this property to 1 to request that the installer use actual user information when setting the AdminUser property. This property is available starting with Windows Installer 4.0.

WindowsProperty.Name: Date
WindowsProperty.Description: The current date.

WindowsProperty.Name: Time
WindowsProperty.Description: The current time.

WindowsProperty.Name: ADDDEFAULT
WindowsProperty.Description: List of features to be installed in the default configuration.

WindowsProperty.Name: ADDLOCAL
WindowsProperty.Description: List of features to be installed locally.

WindowsProperty.Name: ADDSOURCE
WindowsProperty.Description: List of features to be run from source.

WindowsProperty.Name: ADVERTISE
WindowsProperty.Description: List of features to be advertised.

WindowsProperty.Name: COMPADDDEFAULT
WindowsProperty.Description: List of components to be installed in the default configuration.

WindowsProperty.Name: COMPADDLOCAL
WindowsProperty.Description: List of component IDs to be installed locally.

WindowsProperty.Name: COMPADDSOURCE
WindowsProperty.Description: List of component IDs to run from source media.

WindowsProperty.Name: FILEADDDEFAULT
WindowsProperty.Description: List of file keys for files to be installed in the default configuration.

WindowsProperty.Name: FILEADDLOCAL
WindowsProperty.Description: List of file keys for files to be run locally.

WindowsProperty.Name: FILEADDSOURCE
WindowsProperty.Description: List of file keys to be run from the source media.

WindowsProperty.Name: MSIDISABLELUAPATCHING
WindowsProperty.Description: Setting this property prevents Least Privileged User (LUA) patching of an application.

WindowsProperty.Name: MsiPatchRemovalList
WindowsProperty.Description: List of patches to be removed during the installation.

WindowsProperty.Name: MSIRESTARTMANAGERCONTROL
WindowsProperty.Description: Specifies whether the package uses the Restart Manager or FilesInUse functionality.

WindowsProperty.Name: MSIDISABLERMRESTART
WindowsProperty.Description: Specifies how applications or services that are currently using files affected by an update should be shutdown and restarted to enable the installation of the update.

WindowsProperty.Name: MSIRMSHUTDOWN
WindowsProperty.Description: Specifies how applications or services that are currently using files affected by an update should be shutdown to enable the installation of the update.

WindowsProperty.Name: MSIPATCHREMOVE
WindowsProperty.Description: Setting this property removes patches.

WindowsProperty.Name: PATCH
WindowsProperty.Description: Setting this property applies a patch.

WindowsProperty.Name: REINSTALL
WindowsProperty.Description: List of features to be reinstalled.

WindowsProperty.Name: REINSTALLMODE
WindowsProperty.Description: A string that contains letters that specify the type of reinstall to perform.

WindowsProperty.Name: REMOVE
WindowsProperty.Description: List of features to be removed.

WindowsProperty.Name: Alpha
WindowsProperty.Description: The numeric processor level when running on an Alpha processor. Note This property is obsolete, the Alpha platform is not supported by Windows Installer.

WindowsProperty.Name: BorderSide
WindowsProperty.Description: The width of the window borders, in pixels.

WindowsProperty.Name: BorderTop
WindowsProperty.Description: The height of the window borders, in pixels.

WindowsProperty.Name: CaptionHeight
WindowsProperty.Description: The height of normal caption area, in pixels.

WindowsProperty.Name: ColorBits
WindowsProperty.Description: The number of adjacent color bits for each pixel.

WindowsProperty.Name: Intel
WindowsProperty.Description: The numeric processor level when running on an Intel processor.

WindowsProperty.Name: Intel64
WindowsProperty.Description: The numeric processor level when running on an Itanium processor.

WindowsProperty.Name: Msix64
WindowsProperty.Description: The numeric processor level when running on an x64 processor.

WindowsProperty.Name: PhysicalMemory
WindowsProperty.Description: The size of the installed RAM, in megabytes.

WindowsProperty.Name: ScreenX
WindowsProperty.Description: The width of the screen, in pixels.

WindowsProperty.Name: ScreenY
WindowsProperty.Description: The height of the screen, in pixels.

WindowsProperty.Name: TextHeight
WindowsProperty.Description: The height of characters, in logical units.

WindowsProperty.Name: VirtualMemory
WindowsProperty.Description: The amount of available page file space, in megabytes.

WindowsProperty.Name: AFTERREBOOT
WindowsProperty.Description: Indicates current installation follows a reboot that the ForceReboot action invokes.

WindowsProperty.Name: CostingComplete
WindowsProperty.Description: Indicates whether disk space costing is complete.

WindowsProperty.Name: Installed
WindowsProperty.Description: Indicates that a product is already installed.

WindowsProperty.Name: MSICHECKCRCS
WindowsProperty.Description: The Installer does a CRC on files only if the MSICHECKCRCS property is set.

WindowsProperty.Name: MsiRestartManagerSessionKey
WindowsProperty.Description: The Installer sets this property to the session key for the Restart Manager session.

WindowsProperty.Name: MsiRunningElevated
WindowsProperty.Description: The Installer sets the value of this property to 1 when the installer is running with elevated privileges.

WindowsProperty.Name: MsiSystemRebootPending
WindowsProperty.Description: The Installer sets this property to 1 if a restart of the operating system is currently pending.

WindowsProperty.Name: MsiUIHideCancel
WindowsProperty.Description: The Installer sets MsiUIHideCancel to 1 when the internal install level includes INSTALLUILEVEL_HIDECANCEL.

WindowsProperty.Name: MsiUIProgressOnly
WindowsProperty.Description: The Installer sets MsiUIProgressOnly to 1 when the internal install level includes INSTALLUILEVEL_PROGRESSONLY.

WindowsProperty.Name: MsiUISourceResOnly
WindowsProperty.Description: MsiUISourceResOnly to 1 (one) when the internal install level includes INSTALLUILEVEL_SOURCERESONLY.

WindowsProperty.Name: NOCOMPANYNAME
WindowsProperty.Description: Suppresses the automatic setting of the COMPANYNAME property.

WindowsProperty.Name: NOUSERNAME
WindowsProperty.Description: Suppresses the automatic setting of the USERNAME property.

WindowsProperty.Name: OutOfDiskSpace
WindowsProperty.Description: Insufficient disk space to accommodate the installation.

WindowsProperty.Name: OutOfNoRbDiskSpace
WindowsProperty.Description: Insufficient disk space with rollback turned off.

WindowsProperty.Name: Preselected
WindowsProperty.Description: Features are already selected.

WindowsProperty.Name: PrimaryVolumePath
WindowsProperty.Description: The Installer sets the value of this property to the path of the volume that the PRIMARYFOLDER property designates.

WindowsProperty.Name: PrimaryVolumeSpaceAvailable
WindowsProperty.Description: The Installer sets the value of this property to a string that represents the total number of bytes available on the volume that the PrimaryVolumePath property references.

WindowsProperty.Name: PrimaryVolumeSpaceRemaining
WindowsProperty.Description: The Installer sets the value of this property to a string that represents the total number of bytes remaining on the volume that the PrimaryVolumePath property references if all the currently selected features are installed.

WindowsProperty.Name: PrimaryVolumeSpaceRequired
WindowsProperty.Description: The Installer sets the value of this property to a string that represents the total number of bytes required by all currently selected features on the volume that the PrimaryVolumePath property references.

WindowsProperty.Name: ProductLanguage
WindowsProperty.Description: Numeric language identifier (LANGID) for the database. (REQUIRED)

WindowsProperty.Name: ReplacedInUseFiles
WindowsProperty.Description: Set if the installer installs over a file that is being held in use.

WindowsProperty.Name: RESUME
WindowsProperty.Description: Resumed installation.

WindowsProperty.Name: RollbackDisabled
WindowsProperty.Description: The installer sets this property when rollback is disabled.

WindowsProperty.Name: UILevel
WindowsProperty.Description: Indicates the user interface level.

WindowsProperty.Name: UpdateStarted
WindowsProperty.Description: Set when changes to the system have begun for this installation.

WindowsProperty.Name: UPGRADINGPRODUCTCODE
WindowsProperty.Description: Set by the installer when an upgrade removes an application.

WindowsProperty.Name: VersionMsi
WindowsProperty.Description: The installer sets this property to the version of Windows Installer that is run during the installation.

WindowsProperty.Name: AdminUser
WindowsProperty.Description: Set on Windows 2000 if the user has administrator privileges.

WindowsProperty.Name: ComputerName
WindowsProperty.Description: Computer name of the current system.

WindowsProperty.Name: MsiNetAssemblySupport
WindowsProperty.Description: On systems that support common language runtime assemblies, the Installer sets the value of this property to the file version of fusion.dll. The Installer does not set this property if the operating system does not support common language runtime assemblies.

WindowsProperty.Name: MsiNTProductType
WindowsProperty.Description: Indicates the Windows product type.

WindowsProperty.Name: MsiNTSuiteBackOffice
WindowsProperty.Description: On Windows 2000 and later operating systems, the Installer sets this property to 1 (one) only if Microsoft BackOffice components are installed.

WindowsProperty.Name: MsiNTSuiteDataCenter
WindowsProperty.Description: On Windows 2000 and later operating systems, the Installer sets this property to 1 (one) only if Windows 2000 Datacenter Server is installed.

WindowsProperty.Name: MsiNTSuiteEnterprise
WindowsProperty.Description: On Windows 2000 and later operating systems, the Installer sets this property to 1 (one) only if Windows 2000 Advanced Server is installed.

WindowsProperty.Name: MsiNTSuitePersonal
WindowsProperty.Description: On Windows XP and later operating systems, the Installer sets this property to 1 (one) only if the operating system is Workstation Personal (not Professional).

WindowsProperty.Name: MsiNTSuiteSmallBusiness
WindowsProperty.Description: On Windows 2000 and later operating systems, the Installer sets this property to 1 (one) only if Microsoft Small Business Server is installed.

WindowsProperty.Name: MsiNTSuiteSmallBusinessRestricted
WindowsProperty.Description: On Windows 2000 and later operating systems, the Installer sets this property to 1 (one) only if Microsoft Small Business Server is installed with the restrictive client license.

WindowsProperty.Name: MsiNTSuiteWebServer
WindowsProperty.Description: On Windows 2000 and later operating systems, the Installer sets the MsiNTSuiteWebServer property to 1 (one) if the web edition of the Windows Server 2003 is installed. Only available with the Windows Server 2003 release of the Windows Installer.

WindowsProperty.Name: MsiTabletPC
WindowsProperty.Description: The installer sets this property to a nonzero value if the current operating system is Windows XP Tablet PC Edition.

WindowsProperty.Name: MsiWin32AssemblySupport
WindowsProperty.Description: On systems that support Win32 assemblies, the Installer sets the value of this property to the file version of sxs.dll. The Installer does not set this property if the operating system does not support Win32 assemblies.

WindowsProperty.Name: OLEAdvtSupport
WindowsProperty.Description: Set if OLE supports the Windows Installer.

WindowsProperty.Name: RedirectedDllSupport
WindowsProperty.Description: The Installer sets the RedirectedDllSupport property if the system performing the installation supports Isolated Components.

WindowsProperty.Name: RemoteAdminTS
WindowsProperty.Description: The Installer sets the RemoteAdminTS property when the system is a remote administration server running the Terminal Server role service.

WindowsProperty.Name: ServicePackLevel
WindowsProperty.Description: The version number of the operating system service pack.

WindowsProperty.Name: ServicePackLevelMinor
WindowsProperty.Description: The minor version number of the operating system service pack.

WindowsProperty.Name: SharedWindows
WindowsProperty.Description: Set when the system is operating as Shared Windows.

WindowsProperty.Name: ShellAdvtSupport
WindowsProperty.Description: Set if the shell supports feature advertising.

WindowsProperty.Name: SystemLanguageID
WindowsProperty.Description: Default language identifier for the system.

WindowsProperty.Name: TerminalServer
WindowsProperty.Description: Set when the system is a server running the Terminal Server role service.

WindowsProperty.Name: TTCSupport
WindowsProperty.Description: Indicates if the operating system supports using .ttc (true type font collections) files.

WindowsProperty.Name: Version9X
WindowsProperty.Description: Version number for the Windows operating system.

WindowsProperty.Name: VersionDatabase
WindowsProperty.Description: Numeric database version of the current installation.

WindowsProperty.Name: VersionNT
WindowsProperty.Description: Version number for the operating system.

WindowsProperty.Name: VersionNT64
WindowsProperty.Description: Version number for the operating system if the system is running on a 64-bit computer.

WindowsProperty.Name: Windows build
WindowsProperty.Description: Build number of the operating system.

WindowsProperty.Name: ARPHELPLINK
WindowsProperty.Description: Internet address or URL for technical support.

WindowsProperty.Name: ARPHELPTELEPHONE
WindowsProperty.Description: Technical support phone numbers.

WindowsProperty.Name: DiskPrompt
WindowsProperty.Description: String displayed by a message box that prompts for a disk.

WindowsProperty.Name: IsAdminPackage
WindowsProperty.Description: Set to 1 (one) if the current installation is running from a package created through an administrative installation.

WindowsProperty.Name: LeftUnit
WindowsProperty.Description: Places units to the left of the number.

WindowsProperty.Name: Manufacturer
WindowsProperty.Description: Name of the application manufacturer. (Required)

WindowsProperty.Name: MediaSourceDir
WindowsProperty.Description: The installer sets this property to 1 (one) when the installation uses a media source, such as a CD-ROM.

WindowsProperty.Name: MSIINSTANCEGUID
WindowsProperty.Description: The presence of this property indicates that a product code changing transform is registered to the product.

WindowsProperty.Name: MSINEWINSTANCE
WindowsProperty.Description: This property indicates the installation of a new instance of a product with instance transforms.

WindowsProperty.Name: ParentProductCode
WindowsProperty.Description: The installer sets this property for installations that a Concurrent Installation action runs.

WindowsProperty.Name: PIDTemplate
WindowsProperty.Description: String used as a template for the PIDKEY property.

WindowsProperty.Name: ProductCode
WindowsProperty.Description: A unique identifier for a specific product release. (Required)

WindowsProperty.Name: ProductName
WindowsProperty.Description: Human readable name of an application. (Required)

WindowsProperty.Name: ProductState
WindowsProperty.Description: Set to the installed state of a product.

WindowsProperty.Name: ProductVersion
WindowsProperty.Description: String format of the product version as a numeric value. (Required)

WindowsProperty.Name: UpgradeCode
WindowsProperty.Description: A GUID that represents a related set of products.

WindowsProperty.Name: PATCHNEWPACKAGECODE
WindowsProperty.Description: The value of this property is written to the Revision Number Summary Property.

WindowsProperty.Name: PATCHNEWSUMMARYCOMMENTS
WindowsProperty.Description: The value of this property is written to the Comments Summary Property.

WindowsProperty.Name: PATCHNEWSUMMARYSUBJECT
WindowsProperty.Description: The value of this property is written to the Subject Summary Property.

WindowsProperty.Name: AdminToolsFolder
WindowsProperty.Description: The full path to the directory that contains administrative tools.

WindowsProperty.Name: AppDataFolder
WindowsProperty.Description: The full path to the Roaming folder for the current user.

WindowsProperty.Name: CommonAppDataFolder
WindowsProperty.Description: The full path to application data for all users.

WindowsProperty.Name: CommonFiles64Folder
WindowsProperty.Description: The full path to the predefined 64-bit Common Files folder.

WindowsProperty.Name: CommonFilesFolder
WindowsProperty.Description: The full path to the Common Files folder for the current user.

WindowsProperty.Name: DesktopFolder
WindowsProperty.Description: The full path to the Desktop folder.

WindowsProperty.Name: FavoritesFolder
WindowsProperty.Description: The full path to the Favorites folder for the current user.

WindowsProperty.Name: FontsFolder
WindowsProperty.Description: The full path to the Fonts folder.

WindowsProperty.Name: LocalAppDataFolder
WindowsProperty.Description: The full path to the folder that contains local (nonroaming) applications.

WindowsProperty.Name: MyPicturesFolder
WindowsProperty.Description: The full path to the Pictures folder.

WindowsProperty.Name: NetHoodFolder
WindowsProperty.Description: The full path to the NetHood folder.

WindowsProperty.Name: PersonalFolder
WindowsProperty.Description: The full path to the Documents folder for the current user.

WindowsProperty.Name: PrintHoodFolder
WindowsProperty.Description: The full path to the PrintHood folder.

WindowsProperty.Name: ProgramFiles64Folder
WindowsProperty.Description: The full path to the predefined 64-bit Program Files folder.

WindowsProperty.Name: ProgramFilesFolder
WindowsProperty.Description: The full path to the predefined 32-bit Program Files folder.

WindowsProperty.Name: ProgramMenuFolder
WindowsProperty.Description: The full path to the Program Menu folder.

WindowsProperty.Name: RecentFolder
WindowsProperty.Description: The full path to the Recent folder.

WindowsProperty.Name: SendToFolder
WindowsProperty.Description: The full path to the SendTo folder for the current user.

WindowsProperty.Name: StartMenuFolder
WindowsProperty.Description: The full path to the Start menu folder.

WindowsProperty.Name: StartupFolder
WindowsProperty.Description: The full path to the Startup folder.

WindowsProperty.Name: System16Folder
WindowsProperty.Description: The full path to folder for 16-bit system DLLs.

WindowsProperty.Name: System64Folder
WindowsProperty.Description: The full path to the predefined System64 folder.

WindowsProperty.Name: SystemFolder
WindowsProperty.Description: The full path to the System folder for the current user.

WindowsProperty.Name: TempFolder
WindowsProperty.Description: The full path to the Temp folder.

WindowsProperty.Name: TemplateFolder
WindowsProperty.Description: The full path to the Template folder for the current user.

WindowsProperty.Name: WindowsFolder
WindowsProperty.Description: The full path to the Windows folder.

WindowsProperty.Name: WindowsVolume
WindowsProperty.Description: The volume of the Windows folder.

WindowsProperty.Name: AdminProperties
WindowsProperty.Description: ist of properties that are set during an administration installation.

WindowsProperty.Name: COMPANYNAME
WindowsProperty.Description: Organization name of the user who is performing the installation.

WindowsProperty.Name: LogonUser
WindowsProperty.Description: User name for the user who is currently logged on.

WindowsProperty.Name: MsiHiddenProperties
WindowsProperty.Description: List of properties that are prevented from being written into the log.

WindowsProperty.Name: PIDKEY
WindowsProperty.Description: Part of the Product ID that the user enters.

WindowsProperty.Name: ProductID
WindowsProperty.Description: Full Product ID after a successful validation.

WindowsProperty.Name: UserLanguageID
WindowsProperty.Description: Default language identifier of the current user.

WindowsProperty.Name: USERNAME
WindowsProperty.Description: User who is performing the installation.

WindowsProperty.Name: UserSID property
WindowsProperty.Description: Set by the installer according to the security identifier (SID) of the user.
